alert.note: Alert for Albany; Schenectady; Schoharie (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 19 at 3:59PM EDT until September 19 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Schenectady County in east central New York... West central Albany County in east central New York... Schoharie County in east central New York... * Until 500 PM EDT. * At 358 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Sharon Springs to near Summit to Stamford, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Cobleskill, Jefferson, Middleburgh, Gilboa, Summit, Schoharie, Richmondville, Livingstonville, North Blenheim, Breakabeen, Central Bridge, Preston-Potter Hollow, Seward, Conesville, Zeh Corners, West Richmondville, Baird Corners, West Berne, Huntersland and Warnerville. Please report hail size...damaging winds and reports of trees down to the National Weather Service by email at Alb.Stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
